page.title: 03SOCIAL BEHAVIOUR
page.content: A lot of people think that our standards of{behaviour}as a nation are declining so we asked a group of 46 parents what they thought. They agreed, with one exception.The major causes cited were too much{violence}on {T.V,} and too little{home}discipline. {School}discipline was thought to be a factor by about half the group, but inspite of the recent football riots at the Belgian Heysel stadium only a quarter thought{alcohol}was to blame. Poor{church}attendance was not a major factor and again despite the winter's coalmine{strike}and the current teacher's{strike}these also were not thought to be of importance in this field. A quarter thought that greed and selfishness were factors and a fifth thought that{unemployment} contributed.
